info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 9:38AM EST until December 28 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River at Lowell. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage continues. The South Fork Catawba River may begin flooding Riverside Dr. between 5th and 6th Streets in Cramerton. Floodwaters may also approach homes along Catawba Run Rd., near the streamgauge. Hoyle Creek floodwaters, possibly due to backwater effects from the South Fork Catawba River, may begin to impact the Old Willis School Road bridge near Sandcastle Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EST Wednesday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 3.3 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 08/07/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST.
